solution_line_template: There are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in an hour so {train_duration_hours} hour {train_duration_minutes_part} minutes = ({minutes_per_hour}+{train_duration_minutes_part}) minutes = {train_duration_total_minutes} minutes
He will spend a total of {train_duration_total_minutes}+{walk_duration_minutes} = <<{train_duration_total_minutes}+{walk_duration_minutes}={total_travel_minutes}>>{total_travel_minutes} minutes
{total_travel_minutes} minutes is = ({minutes_per_hour}/{minutes_per_hour}) hours and {travel_remaining_minutes} minutes = {travel_hours} hour {travel_remaining_minutes} minutes = 0130 in 24-hr time
He has to leave {travel_duration_display} hours earlier than {arrival_time_display} i.e. {arrival_time_display}-{travel_duration_display} = {departure_time_display} hours
